author: Alistair McGeorge
title: When does The Jump 2017 start? Bradley Wiggins, Lydia Bright and Spencer Matthews will all hit the slopes
text:
TV When does The Jump 2017 start? Bradley Wiggins, Lydia Bright and Spencer Matthews will all hit the slopes Channel 4's annual winter sports show is heading back to TV screens this month and we've got all you need to know about The Jump return date, time and new contestants Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Take a sneak peek at The Jump 2017 Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The Jump is set for its annual return to Channel 4 with a lot of famous faces willing to risk their lives on the slopes. 
A star studded roster is set to prove they're all willing to take their lives into their own hands for this year's series. 
Here's all the information you need about the upcoming series. Read More When is The Jump back on TV? This year's star-studded lineup (Photo: PA) 
Channel 4 has confirmed the new series starts on Sunday 5th February 2017. 
There's not too long to wait - and in a matter of days Davina McCall will be hosting all the action in Austria. Who will be competing this year? 
Bradley Wiggins , TOWIE star Lydia Bright , Josie Gibson and Robbie Fowler are among the stars risking their limbs for a shot at skiing fame, despite the likes of Beth Tweddle and Tina Hobley sustaining serious injuries from previous series. Sir Bradley Wiggins (Photo: PA) 
It will be Spencer Matthews ' chance to redeem himself after a failed attempt to enter the I'm A Celebrity jungle in 2015, which ended when he confessed to taken steroid-type drugs. Read More 
Lydia Bright, meanwhile, will be following in her on-off boyfriend James 'Arg' Argent's footsteps by taking on The Jump - but will she beat his record of being eliminated twice? Spencer Matthews (Photo: PA) Lydia Bright (Photo: PA) 
Speaking to PA ahead of the show's launch, eight-time Olympic medallist Sir Bradley explained how skiing is a big passion of his. 
"It was a mix of that and the other committed names this year that made me want to sign up," he said. 
"Major retiring Olympians such as Sir Steve Redgrave have also trod this path, I see this as a sporting challenge and want to go out there and win it. Just don't call me a celebrity." Full list of The Jump 2017 competitors 
Gareth Thomas - Welsh rugby international player Gareth Thomas (Photo: PA)
